alert.note: Alert for Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 02 at 4:08PM EDT until June 02 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Ulster County in east central New York... * Until 515 PM EDT. * At 408 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over West Hurley, or 8 miles northwest of Kingston, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 4:00 PM, a trained spotter reported quarter size hail near West Hurley. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Hurley, West Hurley, High Falls, Olivebridge, Marbletown, Ashokan, Samsonville, Glenford, Atwood, Sweet Meadows, Pacama, Sawkill, Stone Ridge, Montoma, Morgan Hill, Jockey Hill, Halihan Hill, Cottekill, Winchell and Stony Hollow. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
